popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning

Class ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning.ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool

  • class ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool
extends java.lang.Object
    implements a thread-local pool of ReleaseFNPTask2Object objects. In this way, there will be no need for invoking the new operator within the running threads requiring such objects, unless a thread at some point runs out of space in its thread-local pool. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int _NUMOBJS
      the maximum number of objects this pool can handle.

      private int _topAvailPos 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static ReleaseFNPTask2Object getObject(FNPTask2 data, int threadid)
      factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one.
      (package private) ReleaseFNPTask2Object getObjectFromPool()
      return a managed "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
      (package private) void initialize()
      method is only called from ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectThreadLocalPools right after object construction to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.
      (package private) void returnObjectToPool(ReleaseFNPTask2Object dlp)
      only called from ReleaseFNPTask2Object.release() method.
      (package private) static void setPoolSize(int num)
      sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool

        ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectPool()
        sole public constructor. Creates _NUMOBJS "empty" ReleaseFNPTask2Object objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        static ReleaseFNPTask2Object getObject(FNPTask2 data,
                                       int threadid)
        factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one. The returned object, always has its data members (values) correctly set.
        Parameters:
        data - FNPTask2
        threadid - int
        Returns:
        ReleaseFNPTask2Object

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        method is only called from ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectThreadLocalPools right after object construction to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.

      • getObjectFromPool

        ReleaseFNPTask2Object getObjectFromPool()
        return a managed "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
        Returns:
        ReleaseFNPTask2Object

      • returnObjectToPool

        void returnObjectToPool(ReleaseFNPTask2Object dlp)
        only called from ReleaseFNPTask2Object.release() method.
        Parameters:
        dlp - ReleaseFNPTask2Object

      • setPoolSize

        static void setPoolSize(int num)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified. Must only be called once, before any pool is actually constructed (should only be called from the ReleaseFNPTask2ObjectThreadLocalPools class).
        Parameters:
        num - int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0
